Scholars' Opinions on the Ruling of Selling Dogs in Summary.
Scholars differed on this issue into five opinions:
First Opinion: It is not permissible to sell a dog absolutely, whether trained or untrained.
Second Opinion: It is permissible to sell a dog absolutely.
Third Opinion: It is permissible to buy hunting dogs but not to sell them.
Fourth Opinion: It is permissible to buy and sell dogs that are permitted to be kept.
Fifth Opinion: It is permissible to sell a trained dog.

Therefore: There is no harm on you in treating dogs that people bring to your clinic. By that you are offering kindness and goodness. If you seek reward from Allah, we hope you attain the great reward mentioned in the previous hadith. It does not harm you that some who come to you are not permitted to keep a dog. You are not tasked with inspecting every visitor and the reason for his keeping the dog he brought you. Rather, you intend in your clinic to treat dogs permitted to be kept, and advising those who keep them without need about the prohibition of...
